@GregHuntMP Funding #youth #suicideprevention in addition to #mentalhealth services also allows us to gain better reach and do #earlyintervention and #prevention work. We need to remember, almost 40% of #suicides are from people with no mental health history.

@GregHuntMP Adequately funding community #mentalhealth services through changes to our #betterhealth #medicare system, I hope, will improve the service provision of to some of our most vulnerable. It helps to have more #hospital beds; but most of mental health care occurs in the community.

#Tasmanian‚Äôs with #eatingdisorders have been waiting for adequate, let alone specialist #eatingdisordertreatment. We need skilled clinicians to provide this care here though. I hope our local #mentalhealth clinicians prepare for, and gain competency to do this specialist work. https://t.co/LNcX3APmn9

@AustPsych Increased patient access to care is a very important part of this proposal; especially given the lengthy delays and difficulties encountered in public #mentalhealth systems. Hopefully this will allow us to do our work better and give patients better access to psychological care

@Psych4Men @GregFranklin19 @psychetrick @JulietOcean1 @FiMelb99 @GrantschultzNSW @haldemanka @johno0910 @JulieCollinsMP @DrCraigEmerson @ian_hickie @CatherineKingMP @RenBlackman @KarenJDon @Ouroboros77 @AustPsych Absolutely! We managed to get this #mentalhealth assistance included in my son‚Äôs #NDIS plan. As a powerful advocate for my son, combined with a planner who really listened to our needs we succeded in not needing to navigate two separate systems. But I recognise we are lucky...

@GregFranklin19 @psychetrick @JulietOcean1 @FiMelb99 @Psych4Men @GrantschultzNSW @haldemanka @johno0910 @JulieCollinsMP @DrCraigEmerson @ian_hickie @CatherineKingMP @RenBlackman @KarenJDon @Ouroboros77 @AustPsych I‚Äôve just navigated the #NDIS and have a service plan for my own son; who is profoundly deaf. We have a very supportive plan. It took some time and the process hasn‚Äôt been as successful for others... But, I‚Äôm not sure #mentalhealth sits in the NDIS?! I think it‚Äôs suits #medicare!

@Psych4Men @JulietOcean1 @FiMelb99 @GregFranklin19 @GrantschultzNSW @haldemanka @johno0910 @JulieCollinsMP @DrCraigEmerson @ian_hickie @CatherineKingMP @RenBlackman @KarenJDon @Ouroboros77 @AustPsych You have a lot of experience; I can see how disheartening it is to feel undervalued in this profession. My hope (again maybe optimistic) is that we use this review to unify us all - and that includes other #mentalhealth social workers, OTs and nurses doing work under #medicare.

@AustPsych The queries in this tweet feed seem mainly around #endorsements, #practicecertificates and questions around working with mild and moderate #mentalhealth problems (as well as severe) in non-endorsed #psychologists + implications for patients. Prior learning will hopefully assist?

@JulietOcean1 @FiMelb99 @Psych4Men @GregFranklin19 @GrantschultzNSW @haldemanka @johno0910 @JulieCollinsMP @DrCraigEmerson @ian_hickie @CatherineKingMP @RenBlackman @KarenJDon @Ouroboros77 @AustPsych I think it‚Äôs a great disservice to our patients, if they deteriorate from a mild to a moderate #mentalhealth problem if they have to change #psychologists. I‚Äôm hoping, perhaps too optimistically, that the #practicecertificate acknowledging prior learning will embrace this...

@LizCrowe2 @cianmcdermott And as #mentalhealth professionals, #learnnottoblame is often about remembering to keep our own countertransference in check: take it to #clinicalsupervision. People are often doing the best they can with the cards they are dealt. We need structures in place to support us here.

@fazzer_7 @33Sammi32 This is why we need better psychoeducation for #mentalhealth professionals doing #eatingdisordertretment. But our physical health practitioners need to have more information about the medical aspect of #eatingdisorders as well. We underestimate many medical issues in this area.

@fazzer_7 Little by little... forwards, backwards, stuck and round and round. It‚Äôs all part of #eatingdisorderrecovery. It‚Äôs hard. I truly believe it‚Äôs one of the most difficult #mentalhealth problems to overcome. And this can‚Äôt be emphasised enough.

Weight, body size, height... none define good physical or mental health. It is imperative that we start to think more carefully about how we view ourselves and others. We can have a better relationship with our bodies; we need to overcome the toxic #dietculture we‚Äôve experienced https://t.co/ZQJ1Nz83Ha
